name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Multiple media outlets reported that Hero Entertainment, a shareholder and co-publisher of Black Myth: Wukong, asked streaming creators to avoid discussing topics such as "isolation," "lockdown," "COVID-19," and "feminism" in live broadcasts or videos related to the game, and not to mention policies, opinions, and news related to China's gaming industry.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On August 20, the media reported that a group of principals and vice principals of a middle school in Meishan, Sichuan, embezzled 3.5 million yuan in bribes. Their method of corruption was to turn the school's printing room and canteen into independent operations, and they received bribes of 1.41 million yuan from them.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
On August 20, Yishide Beijing Medical Technology Co., Ltd. issued a statement accusing Ideal Auto of deceiving it to write an apology statement and using it for commercial promotion. It also stated that it would cooperate with Huawei in the future.
In addition, the statement also allegedly attacked the health of Li Xiang, the founder of Ideal Auto, saying that "Li Xiang will die of liver cancer soon if no intervention is made."

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: According to multiple gaming media reports, Hero Entertainment, a shareholder and co-publisher of Black Myth: Wukong, sent an email to some Western streaming creators, asking them to avoid discussing topics such as "isolation," "lockdown," "COVID-19," and "feminism" in live broadcasts or videos related to the game, and not to mention policies, opinions, and news related to China's gaming industry.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
August 20, Xi'an Middle School protest follow-up
After students reported the school's formaldehyde exceeding the standard to the local education department 98 times, the school suspended supplementary classes.
But not only was the reporter found directly afterwards, but the whistleblower also received a call from the police and was asked to delete the post.
At the same time, the school asked parents to pay attention to their children's daily call records
